author: gballet
content:
the pre-existing approach is going to cause issues down the road, and should be changed for 4788 as well: because code is executed during the system call, that code will end up in the verkle witness, and inflating it.

And that's leaving aside the question of rendering client diversity moot if everyone uses the same buggy bytecode, and that of having to conjure up an interpreter for doing exactly the same thing that you would do without that overhead.

author: gballet
content:
that's a good point. The reason for seeding comes from an adaptation of an activation behavior that was meant to use block numbers, to the timestamp-based system. We don't need it on mainnet since 2935 is activated in Prague.

Gajinder correctly raises the point that it might be different on testnets since the Osaka activation could happen within 8192 blocks of Prague, presumably when Prague is activated at genesis and Osaka a few slots later.  

But if Prague is activated at genesis, then there are no previous block hashes to copy. I don't think any other use case (e.g. Prague and `N != 0`, and Osaka at `M` with `M-N < 8192`)  would be relevant to testnets, so we could get rid of this initialization.

author: gballet
content: I would recomment keeping things as is for devnet 0, and discussing it during the interop.

author: g11tech
content:
> since the Osaka activation could happen within 8192 blocks of Prague

we can make seeding conditional on the 2935 activation distance for devnets? basically it won't really affect mainnet and other long running testnets while letting the EIP be complete for such hypothetical devnets

author: gballet
content: I wouldn't do this, since testnets have to be like mainnet as much as possible, otherwise we'd be testing something else

author: g11tech
content: right, also would like to know why <@543900561460822016> doesn't like seeding, it seems like a harmless operation imo and possibly can also happen through evm systemcall by supplying all hashes as input

author: gakonst
content: Sorry so to be clear, are you saying we just activated 4788 but we didn't design it with Verkle in mind? So we need new design for 2935, and possibly 4788 design is bad for verkle?

author: gakonst
content: Which are the best benchmarks for verkle perf vs MPT? Any great codebases people like?
